text: There was nothing to complain about on my visit. The food and service were both good. Although I found it odd that rice was a la cart rather than included with a main dish. They can do it however they want but it would have been nice to have been advised before the food was served.

So impressed by the quality and tastes. Ordered a couple items off the appetizer list. The masala shrimp was delicious, pastry/filo exterior. The seared scallops were cooked to perfection. The Malai chicken tikka was unbelievable, sauces were perfect, chicken was so tender and moist. Gobi manchurian is a must have, I don't know what else to say but get it. And then get the cheese naan, super tasty!!

Liked the food very much.!!
We are vegetarian and loved the dishes though there are very less options.

Delicious! My son and I came in for lunch and was greeted by friendly staff and immediately seated. The place was very clean and our waiter, Evan, was so helpful in answering questions about items on the menu and recommending dishes. Highly recommend and look forward to returning.
Food was amazing, tandoori platter was good variety. Garlic naan was the best. And the chai expresso martini is a must. Definitely plan on coming back for more, glad I stopped in to check it out.

Definitely the best Indian Food in Las Vegas....Very Authentic Indian Food.. 
Yummy Dal Makhani.....and Awesome Channa Masala...

Visited Turmeric when I was in LV last week for some recreation. I think it is fairly new on Fremont Street. Unfortunately I was alone, so I couldn't order several different dishes; hence only 4 stars because of my small sample.  But... good garlic naan, and the Lamb Saag (lamb in a savory spinach sauce) was outstanding, probably the best I've ever had. Definitely will be back next trip.

One of the softest indian Naans I have ever had in US. The restaurant owner looked very passionate about cooking and asked our review multiple times. The menu is kept simple and spicy level is about right for everyone. I recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for good Indian food around this area.

This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the world! The downtown Las Vegas location is perfect.  (Right across from Container Park). The food is modern Indian.

They have the most incredible Naan.  Their Vegan and Vegetarian menus are fantastic!

Great food and even better service. Had the biryani, the curry and garlic naan with no complaints.  Ask for the mango Lassi, it was great too. Didn't know they have three locations in town. I'll definitely be back to try them all.
The best veg biryani i have ever tasted in USA. Though food was expensive, taste was really good.
Freaking amazing omg sesame eggplant and cauliflower appetizers incredible wine is good people are kind you must try this if you love Indian food this is place

This is the best Indian food I had in Las Vegas in many years, the food is absolutely authentic Indian , the flavors were awesome. Head chef Vikas is excellent and the best part was friendly service , definitely must visit place in Vegas , all the best and please open a branch in LA.

Boomchi ??

This place is awesome. Great staff, Anoop and his team were so welcoming and gave great recommendations for food and local area attractions. 

THE food was great! I had the Tandpori Wings and Chicken Korma.  While the Chicken Korma came out almost deconstructed  (I'm used to cubed chicken in the korma instead of on top) everything was extremely tasty. The Korma had a grear balance of flavor and heat and the original flavor wings were fantastic. Service was timely, polite, personal and professional.  I will definitely be coming back!

This will be one of my go-to Indian places from now on. I don't live near downtown, but it is so worth the drive! The location is perfect since container park is right across the street. 
Ronald is a fantastic server!! He may also be a mind reader. Seriously, neither of us had a clue what we wanted so we asked him to pick and everything was delicious! I'm excited to try more of the menu. 

Go to Turmeric, get seated in Ronald's section, have a couple drinks, and enjoy delicious food with exceptional service!!

Ambience is spectacular and the presentation is great but the food is pretty marginal. 

Most dishes were deep fried. Low quality ingredients.  Disappointingly bad!
Chicken tikka Masala  and the lamb Biryani was good the shrimp kasundi was bad the nan bread was also good and the service was good

First time here and we were not disappointed. We had the Gobi Manchurian for our appetizer. My husband had the Butter Chicken spice 7. My husband said it was not hot. I had the Lamb Madras Curry. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. We will be back.

Probably one of the best Indian food places in town. Loved everything we tried. My favorite was the Gobi Machurian and the Chicken Tikka Masala, my husband loves the Vindaloo. Staff was very friendly too.

Food was omg so amazing. Very flavorful. I had the chicken tikka and my husband had the butter chicken. All I can say is AAA MAZE ZING! We also had the tandoori wings for an app and it so delicious! 

Service was great! We were greeted at the door and our waitress for very attentive. I will definitely come back here when I come to Vegas!

We were exploring downtown Las Vegas looking for a new hang out place and I think we found the winner! This place is not to crowded you have ton of space for dancing they also have seating areas based on first come first serve. Staff are friendly and welcoming doesnt take forever to get drinks which is awesome. They have a game area also near the restrooms. Great music selection definitely will be back , thanks!

The menu was excellent, the flavors were delicious, the food was made with fresh and healthy ingredients, the vibe was hip, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I highly recommend this delectable Indian treat.
Food taste & service was amazing.   Not enough serving staff available (at least that day)

Ordered lamb kebab, curry Rogan Josh with Lamb, basmati rice and garlic naan. The prices are comparable to other restaurants in the area.  Very relaxed chill vibe with techno music playing  softly over the speakers.  

Well spiced not overwhelming.   Delicious and quick service!!

This is absolutely the best Indian food my wife who is from South India and I have eaten. Wonderfully prepared and elegantly served.  

We had the masala shrimp, spiced soft shell crab for appetizer and masala dosa for the main course.  The lachha paratha went perfectly with the meal.

Ronald is a gentleman and a pleasant server.  This made our last night in Vegas just perfect!

So happy to have found an Indian Restaurant that has delicious authentic food and great ambience. Thank god they don't throw everything in a muddled cream sauce and call it curry. I hope they stay this way and don't turn it into a buffet only place like many other Indian restaurants have done.
The only critique I have and might stop me from going is the chairs they use upstairs for bigger group tables. There are high bar stools and tables that looked comfy but the bigger group tables and chairs are extremely uncomfortable. The height ratio of the chairs to tables is really odd. I hope management switches those out. 
The service was good! We were treated nicely and timely. thumbs up!
Amazing food, one of the best Indian food I've tasted.. Definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas...

I am a regular at curry leaf-flavors of India, so when I heard about Turmeric-flavors of India (same ownership) I decided to give it a try. This place is located in downtown Las Vegas right across from Container park. 
I found the the best Indian restaurant in Vegas that not only offers very creative fusion Indian but also some very authentic finger licking traditional Indian food. 
We started with their summer Fresca salad - beautiful blend of watermelon and feta with spicy quinoa. I have never tasted quinoa this good! This was followed by a very famous Indian street food called Pani puri shots (highly recommend!!) also had their grilled eggplant with peanut sesame crust and Masala shrimp served on crisp filo. So yummmy!! For mains we had the signature chicken tikka masala (authentic Indian food at its best) vegetable dum biryani, garlic and plain naan and masala dosa which was served with 3 types of chutneys and authentic Tamil sambhar. It was delish. We were so full but decided to try some dessert.. we had the dessert trio which had gajar halwa (warm carrot pudding) mango kulfi and gulab jamun. Also tried their Apple cinnamon crumble. Everything was just perfect! Our server Ronald was the best, gave us some great food recommendations, very efficient and friendly. 
They have some great fusion cocktails, beer and wine. I can't wait to return and try the rest of the menu.

I just loved this place. 
Specially the palak planner kofta curry. Rice n Nan was complementary. The dish was very much different n tasty. Very near to Fremont street experience so the best option for Indian food if you visiting downtown.

Major kudos to the servers at this place!! There was an angry Indian family loudly fighting with the server for 25 minutes at their table. Once they got the check they went and loudly argued with the owner for another 15 minutes about their check. The servers and owner stayed classy and handled the situation like pros. I was beyond impressed! 

My family ordered the chicken biryani, plain dosas and uthaapam. Food was delicious and everyone enjoyed their meals. Service was prompt and courteous. Their signature house cocktail is worth trying. 

I will definitely be back!

So happy to have found an excellent Indian restaurant in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is good too, good location but most importantly the food is amazing. Everything I've had so far has been excellent.

I'm so glad they deliver via Bitesquad (it is sometimes hard to eat out with an active toddler). I was so sad that this time the rice wasn't included in my palak paneer kofta, but i will make sure to put a note for the next order.

Have not had food here yet but stumbled upon this place while hanging with my cousin that lives in Vegas as far walking down Fremont St.  Little did I know that they had a club thing going on at night.  It was $5 to get in and the drinks were cheap.  You can play toss the bean bag here.  They also offer bottle service, good music and a nice view of DTLV.  All for a minimal cost.  So far the best bang for the buck for those looking to save money while turning up in Vegas.  Parking is scattered around.  Watch your time in the parking lot because the parking mafia wastes NO TIME issuing tickets.

My boyfriend and I are locals and we finally tried this place out after hearing such great things about it. We only had a taste (drinks and an appetizer) but we were certainly impressed with our brief visit.

Honestly at first we were a little put off by the blasting house music... it felt like we were coming up on a night club as we walked up the street towards the building. But after we entered and went to the bottom floor bar/restaurant area the music was much more mild and the ambiance was a lot more relaxed. 

Decor is simple and modern and there is a beautiful open window area for people watching. Container park is across the street so you might just get to see the praying mantis dragon spew some fire! 

Our drinks and our Gobi were really good and the service was awesome. Will definitely come back for a proper lunch/dinner sometime soon as they have TONS of vegan options that I'm dying to try.

As a veteran Indian food lover, I'm ecstatic that Las Vegas has an Indian restaurant that is up to the caliber of London or New York. You can't go wrong at Turmeric, from the onion kulcha, which is rich in carmelized, red onions, to the chicken saag, everything is spectacular! Highly recommended.
Great food, they also had a separate "Vegan Menu" listing all of the dishes that could be made vegan!
This is one of the finest Indian cuisines i visited recently. The chef make ultimate delicacies for vegetarian and vegans. If you are visiting vegas downtown, this is the perfect place  for dining

Best & freshest Indian food I've EVER had!!!
Grest new restaurant here in Vegas,
Thank you manager Jeremy  & Chef Vikas, spectacular food!!!!!

We had the Aloo Papdi Chaat for the appetizer. And we had the Madras Curry. Both vegetarian. Excellent meal and service. Atmosphere was great!  Very clean!  Wonderful experience!  Price was very reasonable.

We went here for lunch; overall good restaurants with short man power.  We ordered pani puri shots and Samosa for appetizers... they were both ok ... with 3 pcs each.  Veg. Biryani was really good and veg. Platter wasn't up to the mark.  Black daal was delicious as well.  Overall good food.

What a GEM! I knew to not expect a mums Indian curry and was expecting the worst but HOLY COW what great food!! The starter that they give with chick pea and mint chutney was a nice sweet/savory southern cornbread with a Indian twist- absolutely super! I had chicken korma - this had a flavorful vegetable side and chicken breast (which is a nono) but hey the white folk who don't eat curry won't know- and tomato quinoa was bleck- HAVE THE MASALA PEARS for desert you will DIE and go to HEAVEN! I am a die hard Indian foodie so this is HUGE- I'm super pleased to support a local business! Well done! But be ready for something different but awesome and well thought out!

Menu was so limited, staff standing at the door where you couldn't walk in then didn't seat you  just told you to sit where ever. For the price I should have had more attention plus no parking..Go to Ghandi's on Paradise..

We had dinner at Turmeric Flavors of India after the visit to Freemont Street Experience. The restaurant is 2 blocks from the Slotzilla and it closes at 10 pm on weekdays and 11 pm on Friday and Saturday, so plan accordingly.

We ordered Biryani, Naan and Paneer. The food was delicious. The Biryani was cooked just right and the Paneer Makhni was just the right level of spicy and sweet.

The best Indian food I have ever eaten.  Had the Summer Fresca Salad (incredible), Chicken Biryani and Garlic Naan.  Absolutely fantastic, and reasonably priced.  Good service, too, and the Chef came over to check on my meal.  Great restaurant.
Probably the best resturnant for indian food lovers in las vegas . The food was good in taste , highly presentable and tasty indian food

Thank you for Chef Harish ... He's the best chef in Vegas  ... Love his foods good test & very Delicious  

we come very weeks ..

Me and my wife really liked the food here and the ambience with Hindi AR rehman songs was gorgeous!

Service was fast as well!

Salmon in main course was exceptional!
Chilli naan was also really nice.

Paneer makhni could have been better but was still good.

We didn't liked beat chaat which we ordered in appetizer.

We popped in here for a late lunch. A cute spot on the edge of old downtown, we had empty bellies and high delicious hopes for this hipster looking Indian joint. 

I started it off right with a delightful mango lassi that was unusual since it was spiked with cardamom. That was a perfect thirst quencher! I was ready to get this started!

Next up? The eggplant appetizer. It had a significant kick to it, that I was not at all expecting. That was fun. 

For the main we decided to split the tandoori platter: salmon, shrimp, chicken and lamb. With a side of naan. 

Here's where disappointment settles in. The shrimp were severely over cooked. The chicken breast was dry. The lamb popsicle was only, meh. We've had better. The salmon was also over cooked. The salad was okay. The delicious thing on the plate was the minced lamb, but it was slightly dry as well.

Maybe the kitchen was having an off day?

Came during lunch on a weekday. It was pretty empty but, we didn't let that scare us away. 
We sat in the bar area where there are huge windows and a view of Fremont Street. 

We ordered Aloo Tiki Chat, Gobi Manchurian, Chicken Tikka Masala & Garlic Naan. Forgive any misspellings of these dishes. They were all excellent. So much so, my mouth is watering just typing this review. Will definitely be back!
Great decor n presentation, tasty food , it was a bit busy and if you want to watch the street ask for a table next to window

I absolutely love this place. My husband and I eat here sometimes up to three times a week. The staff and the ambience is incredible. This place is such an amazing twist on Indian with a subtle modern flair.
The taste is fabulous and its not like other indian restaurent who offer buffet but not tasty food

I really wanted to like this place so bad since it's close to where I live and I love to try new places 

Sadly I was extremely disappointed.... they had a game playing and it was BLARING I couldn't even think straight 


The table was dirty some of the tables looked like they hadn't been wiped down at all smh 

The server brought me a menu which was I paper no biggie except there were no drinks on it what so ever I guess I'm suppose to assume what they have????? They had a bar but not sure what they serve since there was no menu 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala and cheese naan 

I'm not sure what was in my naan but it couldn't of been cheese it was horrible and was not cheesy AT ALL 

My chicken tikka which is my favorite I ALWAYS order this was uhhhh blah the chicken tasted like it wasn't cooked all the way I didn't even want to eat it I just packed it up and took it to go 

Maybe they had an off day not sure but I won't be back I will keep going to India oven 

*****the only good thing was the server was nice****
We had amazing food! The service was good. They were cool about making adjustments to menu items. Very accommodating. Contemporary atmosphere. Open air club on second level.

This place is very tasty! There are also a ton of vegetarian and vegan options, so it's a good choice if you have non meat eaters in the group. Only downside is that it's slightly more pricey than you'd expect for Indian food, but I suppose that's true of any restaurant downtown.

What a splendid restaurant. Nothing average about this place except for the cocktails. The main show - cuisine- is not your typical Indian food. This is high quality cooking which you would have a hard time finding in these United States. Nearest comparison is the Michelin star Junoon in Manhattan. Only this was better. I am blown away by this place. I just prey the cook stays as I wish to come back here  on my next trip to Vegas.

Unfortunately the restaurant was having a Yelp event so I could not sit or see the main dining room... So I can't speak on the ambiance. But, I consider myself a really picky Indian food junkie. This place is seriously the best I've been to, including NYC. The flavors are so authentic, yet there are also new twists on the cuisine I've never seen before. I recommend the pani puri shots. I tried the butter chicken which is anything but the boring butter chicken you usually think of. Will definitely be back.
Really great Indian food in downtown Las Vegas. We will definitely be back! Waiter might have missed a detail or two, but he was very attentive and friendly.  The naan was ought of this world!

Only if there were more stars to give I would happily give them all! 
We walked in for lunch on a Monday when they had just opened their doors so the restaurant was empty but the aroma of spices literally dragged us inside!!! 

The servers were amazing! Very polite, welcoming and quick! The restaurant is clean, smells nice and is well lit. 

We ordered the aloo tikki chaat for appetizer. The portion size was good and can be easily shared between 2! The chutneys were nice and spicy as we wanted them to be and tasted really authentic. 

For the main course, we ordered dal makhni (served with 1/2 naan, and a cup of rice), butter chicken and butter naan. 
The naans were nice and soft and well buttered. 
The dal was awesome with great amount of spices used. 
The butter chicken was very authentic in appearance and in taste. 

I loved how they plate every dish neatly and garnish them so beautifully with the best of the ingredients. 
Can't wait to go back to Vegas and to Turmeric again!
Excellent vegan options. Fried cauliflower tastes like generals chicken. Unique cocktails. I'll be back.
My favorite place to eat out in vagas , authentic Indian food well prepared and served . Loved the food and the ambience .

Absolutely fantastic meal!  The samosas were light & flakey, rice was fluffy, naan was crisp but tender inside & the Tikki Masala was perfection. Best Indian restaurant I've been to!  Server/bartender Juan was extremely helpful and had a great energy about him. Trust me...walk past the flashy lights in Fremont to this establishment just across from Container Park!  You won't regret it. P.S. I requested my meal be 8/10 spicy and it was spot on!

This review is for the club/music, not for the meals 

We hit rooftop/patio this last Saturday around 1am , and the DJ and his crew were putting out mixes and beats that were simply sublime.   Best damn dj crew I've ever heard.  

The drinks were a bit pricey, but well worth the price considering there was no cover for this great music.

People jamming on the dance floor, and plenty of heavy duty misters to keep everyone cool.    

When we left we got the DJ's card and it pointed us to this:  https://twitter.com/DwnTwnFunktion

Definitely check it out.

Came here with my Indian colleague, everything was perfect. The food was extremely good with great presentation and the service was impeccable. I recommend their special gin and tonic (safran, turmeric, curry leaves). It's a great way to get tasty food outside the strip.
Food was good but expensive. Curry bowls do not come with rice and they charge $5 per bowl of rice. Service was slow.

Absolutely delicious. It is pricey, but my goodness the flavors and ingredients are well worth it. There were options I haven't seen anywhere else in town, and all were extremely flavorful. Great vegan, veg, and gluten free options. There is a spinach side with mustard seeds that was heaven in a bowl. The scallops were perfectly seasoned, and the lamb was cooked flawlessly. My only critique is I wish they had some great iced teas to choose from.
Food here is just amazing and with a new twist.Best Biryani we had in years. Chef Harish and Server Shay was just wonderful.Must visit place in Vegas !!

My neighbor told me about this fabulous restaurant, and I tried it the next day.  Excellent food!  The service the first time I went was slow because the waiter was alone, but the service and his manners were so impeccable, I did not care!  He recommended the cauliflower and I have to have it every time now! I have been back twice in less than a month, taking someone new each time to introduce them to this great place.  The cocktails are amazing!  The waiter tells me they have two other restaurants, but because downtown is easy to get to and a fun place to be, and this is across from Container Park, this is the only Indian Restaurant I need to know about!

This was the best Indian food I've ever had, the Naan was amazing and so was the curry. I had the veggie platter and it was a great variety of flavors, definitely recommend. I will be back to taste the rest of the menu, but also for the cocktails, they look so good! (Dessert was to die for)

Food was good. Terrible service: we asked for booth told it was unavailable. While all 3 booths were wide open.
Then we had to wait 22 minutes to be seated. Once seated we had to wait 16 minutes for the menu. I don't know if they were understaffed or not, but that waitress wss working hard running around so i dont blame her.
Once we got the menu, we ordered food. We didn't even get water to the table until our appetizer came. Talking about water. It never got refilled. We even asked for a water refill. I guess they forgot. I literally had to drink water from family's glasses. They took out a gratuity for their terrible service.

Food was great though!

Great location, patio dining, and AMAZING food! Every bite was bursting with flavor and it was a special treat as a vegetarian to have so many menu options. My meat-loving husband not only was enjoying his meat-filled platter, but couldn't keep his hands off my veggie dishes. Can't wait to try this restaurant again.
Unique menu and yummy food with mix cuisine. Love all the variety-and food. Will recommend this place.

For my first time trying Indian food, I would say that this place blew my mind and I can't express how amazing their food is. My friends and I ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and the Madras Curry along with the Naan bread and I have been craving them since. Highly recommend this place and I would definitely go back whenever I hit Vegas!

PS: They have a club right next door so you can party while eating bomb food!

This place was so good with friendly service. I was craving some Indian food and decided to try this new place downtown, it exceeded my expectations. I tried the Lamb Bobabuska (something like that). It's was very different than what I was expecting in a very very good way. I can't wait to come back. I tried some of my friends eggplant appetizer and her portobello mushroom dish was also incredibly delicious!
Once again I wasn't disappointed with my dinner. This is the best India chow on Nevada.

Amazing place,wonderful service by Ronny and his team...I had the Lamb Biryani and it was the best one in town!
I shall definitely be back!

Turmeric, A Taste of India has my picky tastebuds singing Hallelujah! I'm a hard to please home chef. It's got to the point I won't order or eat out because I can cook it better then whereever I eat. I know, a bit fulll of myself, but I'm sure some of you will agree with me. With that said the cuisine here is fabulous! In fact we went back for lunch the next day. We come down from St.George, UT, which I call the Culinary Black Hole. We have to drive down to Vegas to get a decent dining experience! We are so glad to have found another place we can visit.

My favorite Indian spot in Vegas. I even had my birthday party here. They were fully accommodating for my big group and even help set up some decorations my girl left ahead a time. Everything here is good. I recommend the Tikki Masal and Aloo Gobi.

My family decided to eat here today, and took me along. I love Indian food so I was very pleased with the restaurant choice. This is a very cute location across the street from the Container Park. Walking in through the bar is nice, but the dining area is dim and in need of some art work to brighten up the walls. 

Our waitress was very attentive, and got us our White Linen drinks (a patented specialty drink with white cranberry and elderflower) and orders in very quickly. The staff was extremely knowledgeable on veganism and what items are, and are not. 

Our food arrived in a timely manner. Everyone at my table ordered the lunch specials. I asked for mine to be Very Spicy, and was slightly disappointed since it wasn't quite as spicy as I hoped. However, the flavors were incredible. This had to be one of the best vindaloos that I've had in Las Vegas, and I've had quite a number. 

By the end of our meal, everything had been devoured. We left happy and full and will definitely be coming back again.

Wow, what a great find. We were walking around downtown looking for something to eat and stumbled upon this place. There was a big party going on upstairs, but dining downstairs was quiet and comfortable. 

We really enjoyed the Chicken Tikka & Gobi Manchurian. I really enjoyed the flavor and the presentation was beautiful. The wait staff was excellent.

I'm glad to see new places like this showing up in Vegas.

Amazing food and customer service. My wife and I came across this place while on vacation. It's located in a really cool arts district in downtown Vegas. You will not be disappointed, The food is fresh, flavorful, and inventive. O, and the decor and seating are very comfortable and inviting.
Great food and service at this place!  The Tandoori Plate, Chili Chicken are amazing. The vegetarian options of Cauliflower and Eggplant are delicious too.

Love! So delicious, super friendly. Bar area is perfect for people and sunset watching. Started off with some tapas and drinks, followed with garlic naan, dinner, and lemon rice. Dosa is a must! You don't ever miss meat with a great veggie Indian dish.

This restaurant has been a long time in coming so the owners had plenty of time to decide on their business plan.  The latest of a trio of Indian restaurants, I think this one has an identity crisis.  Is it more of a bar in the Fremont East District that just happens to serve Indian food or is it a restaurant that prominently features a bar?

I entered about 10 minutes after it's 5 PM dinner hour opening.  I was shown to a table in the bar area.  Unlike other Indian restaurants, this one had the football game on TV instead of the normal Bollywood music with dancers.  That's OK with me though.  It's up to them.

When I looked at the menu I was surprised by how limited it was.  On the back was a list of traditional curries and to my memory they were all vegetarian options--again OK--but not what I was looking for.  I saw a sign out front that said the soup of the day was lentil soup (see my photo for the exterior shot and you'll see the sign).  When I asked the server about this, she pointed to an $11 lentil soup on the menu.  She then said she could have them make a cup size portion rather than the larger size.  Seeing nothing else I wanted on the menu, I opted for the beef curry and I ordered garlic naan.  I had already been brought the iced tea I asked for when I was first seated.

A server brought me a small Indian cake as an amuse but I couldn't understand his description.  (A Yelp friend let me know that this is dhokla made from chick pea flour.)   It was good with some nice Indian spices in the cake.  Then came the lentil soup.  It was a large bowl but it wasn't that deep which was OK.  However, I didn't see a lentil anywhere and I'd refer to it as lentil broth rather than lentil soup.  There was not even a texture of ground lentils in the bowl.  (Check my photo against the lentil soup photo someone else has posted and note the difference.)  

The beef curry came.  I had ordered it at spice level 4 out of 5.  If you like spicy food, order the 5 because this could have had more zing to it.  The curry was OK but nothing exceptional.  A serving of basmati rice came with the curry.  The naan was OK but needed more garlic.  My iced tea was refreshed without asking.

They have recently opened but there are a couple of things to note.  The lunch menu appears to have more of what I'd want than the dinner one.  When I asked my server if they had two menus, one for the bar area and one for the dining room area, she said no and brought me their lunch and their dinner menus.  Lunch has lamb rogan josh--something I would have ordered instead of the beef.  When I  pointed this out, she showed me the lamb rack that's on their dinner menu and said that could be made into rogan josh--just ask.  Really?  If I want curry chicken I have to guess that you'll make it for me.

As for the surroundings, this is where the Fremont East District comes into play.  There is a counter running along the windows of this corner restaurant with stools so people can sit at the counter and watch the people at the Container Park or just coming and going on Fremont Street.  Yesterday, all three garage door style windows were open.  One was shut when the west breezes were strong and almost blew the menu off the table.  The windows facing the Container Park remained open all the time I was there.  

I saw last December that this restaurant was coming in 2016.  It finally made it and I was glad to give it a try when I knew they were open.  My experience tells me that it's the one and only time I'll be there.  We have just too many better choices for Indian food without having to get beef.  You need to decide what kind of business you want Turmeric to be.  Note:  their website does not yet have a menu listing.

Everything was delicious.
More than what I expected.
Scallop appetizer was delicious, and so was the dinner for two sampler plate.
Ended with the best chai tea.
Will be back in the near future!
A nice Indian restaurant. Tried pani puri, gobi manchurian, Kerala Fish curry, dum biryani. Very tasty and pleasant experience.
Everything that we ordered was excellent. I'd definitely recommend the spiked mango lassi and the chicken pie. Service was top notch as. well

I was excited to see an Indian food restaurant downtown and was equally excited to try it.  My friend and I went for lunch and we were not disappointed. We ordered the chicken and lamb entrees and both were outstanding. The lamb had just the right amount of heat/spice and the chicken was a little more mild, but very flavorful. The entrees come with choice of plain, butter or garlic nan. We had the garlic nan and it was delicious--light, crunchy and chewy in all the right places. Service was nice, I appreciated the honesty when I asked about having the chicken tikka appetizer as my lunch, and was advised that the appetizer portions may be smaller than I would want. Decor was hip and clean. Nice people watching location. Prices were a little on the higher side, but the quality of the food reflected that. I'd go there again.

Ok I have been thinking a really long time about my feelings on this place.   My first encounter had been through a yelp elite event,  and that experience was 5 star specifically because there were some stand out dishes that were so amazing they conteracted some of the items that were not excuted in the best manner. Two of the items that blew my mind the most were the spinach kofta and the grilled eggplant.   I had been thinking about them everyday for a full week until I finally asked my boyfriend if he would go on a downtown adventure to satiate this need I had. 

When we get to the resturant I thought it would be fun to sit more towards the front this time so we could see the container park.  The last time I had been sequestered in the back where there are no windows to take in the fun that is downtown.   However this was my first mistake because in the front they have this lighting that beams down on you in multiple colors and  was making my eyes hurt and tear up.   When we left my eyes almost breathed a sigh of relief from the strain they had been put under.   The effect of the lighting was also weird because when we got our food it made all the curry's and drinks the same color.  Not very visually appetizing,  and not smart if you want people to take pictures of the food to promote it later. 
It was all this intense shade of orange. 

Now I was willing to put up with all of this because I wanted the magic I had experienced the week prior.   First off, while the eggplant was good,  it was not mind blowing like the prior time.   The first time they seemed to have cooked it longer renduring it with a deeper smokey flavor and more tender mouth feel.   The other sauces that had the tang, sweet,  and spicy qualities were still there and amazing,  and the labneh cooled it down and rounded it out,  but it still just was not the same. 

I still had hope my spinach kofta surely would not disappoint me! Here it comes along with my boyfriends chicken tikka masala.  All looking the same weird color under the light,  and I take a bite and it is different tasting.  The kofta itself is still delicate and full of texture and wonder, but the sauce that was supposed to bring it all together tasted off.   I had my boyfriend try it since I had brought leftovers last time,  and he agreed it tasted different.  I asked the waitress if they changed the sauce.   She checked with the chef and said it was the same and apologized it tasted different.  She said maybe it tasted different since it was not the same chef as the day of the yelp event.  My boyfriends sauce tasted weirdly similar too, and later I realized it was the fact that they both were just overly salted that it took away from all the amazing flavors, and now was just basically one note.   I even felt my tummy a little more aggrivated that night from the food,  which had not happened before.   

Now I will say the waitress was very nice and apologetic, and asked if I wanted something else.  However I was already a bit filled from my appetizer and some of the food I had.   I also was thinking it would all just be the same problem if the chef was just not on point that night.  

I did enjoy my mango lassie, it was unique and had spices you don't normally find in the beverage. It's just for prices like 19 dollars for the kofta, and 17 for the chicken tikka,  in a world of all you can eat 10 and 12 dollar Indian buffets,  you have to be on your A game.  You have to be consistent even when it's not a special event, and you need an environment that is enjoyable to sit in.   For future reference there upstairs outside terrace will be open soon,  however that was not an option yet.   I want to love this place like I did the first time,  I want to be able to give it a better review.  However, all things considered, for now this what I am left with.
Delicious garlic naan bread, colorful and perfectly spiced Chili Chicken, very friendly staff and dynamite location.

I'm not usually crazy for Indian food but the food here rea really impressed me. I sampled most of the appetizers and they were all excellent. Service was extremely friendly and very helpful with explaining the menu and offering advice.

Food is good tasty
Waiters service stupid 
I don't go no more bcoz of waiters service 
Waiters like to my Boss
I never see waiters do insults customer like that

The cilantro chutney had a weird taste to it and that spoiled aloo chat. Yellow lentil was alright but the black lentil tasted only of garlic. They serve cream in the name of yoghurt. The place looked good from outside but the food was a huge disappointment. We had to wait for about 20 mins to get our check. Nobody in the restaurant looked like they were interested in working there. If I could give less than 1 star, I would.
The food is amazing. Veggie platter is yummy and spinach kofta is a must to order. The server was helpful and knowledgeable.

Authentic Indian food and good ambience in the heart of downtown Las Vegas (right opposite the container park). 

I was here for dinner and ordered the madras curry w/ chicken (medium), a tandoori roti and a sweet lassi. The portions were a little bigger than what I was expecting. The curry was flavorful and the lassi seemed fresh - I couldn't taste any artificial flavors, which is quite rare 

For dessert, I ordered the gajar halwa (grated carrot  in syrup) with ice cream. Again, I was pleasantly surprised with the fresh and authentic flavors.

I haven't been to their other restaurants (Saffron and Curry Leaf), however, I will definitely be making more trips to Curry Leaf since it's so close to home. Anyway, all of their menus are slightly different and Turmeric is a little more adventurous as its not your traditional Indian fare.

House-cured Salmon ($12) with green pea relish, potato chaat, cress, and puffed rice. Delicious salmon paired with great Indian spices. A light start to your meal.

Aaloo Papdi Chaat ($10): Spiced potato, garbanzo, wheat crisps, cilantro, tamarind, and yogurt chutney. One of their tasty salad options; again, light and a great combination of flavors.

Lamb Rogan Josh ($16): Kashmir-style lamb curry with brown onions, ginger, fennel, and spices; served with basmati rice and roasted vegetables. This is, hands down, one of my favorite Indian dishes! Extremely flavorful! I loved eating it with the rice and naan.

Black Lentil ($8): Slow-cooked black lentils with tomato and fenugreek. Perfectly hearty with great flavor! Great side or even a main dish.

Garlic Naan ($3): I love an affinity for all breads and naan is one of my favorites. Slightly chewy, lightly crispy on the exterior from the tandoor, and garlic, flavorful!

Stuffed Naan ($5): We opted for Paneer (a type of cheese) and again, tasty. I loved using this one to eat the Lamb since the flavor of the naan was mellow.

Berries and Ginger Crumbles ($11): Mixed berry compote and ginger crumble with vanilla ice cream. Very much like a cobbler, I didn't expect to enjoy it as much as I did. The compote was delicious and I loved the ginger crumbles. Fantastic dessert!

I'm not in DTLV often, however, this is a great option if you're in the area and if you want a little different take on your usual Indian food. Service was wonderful and they have a really cool rooftop bar with views of Fremont Street.

Great stuff. My wife and I split an order of samosas, butter chicken (7 hot) and garlic nan. The samosas were some of the best we have had. The butter chicken was spicy and delicious as advertised and the sauce was perfect for dipping the garlic nan.
Excellent Indian food in the Freemont district.  We had the beef curry, lamb rogan josh, and garlic naan.  The Dharma Initiative is a refreshing cocktail.
Ordered off the veggie menus and the food was outstanding and very unique. The vibe is also super cool and in a great location on Fremont Street downtown. Love those Califlower dishes! Delicious!

Awesome Indian food right downtown at Fremont/7th Street across from the Container Park.  Just opened so things are being tweeked.  Service was a little slow, and staff needs to get a bit more familiar with the menu.  The food is awesome.  Good portions for the price, and very tasty.  If you like it hot, you may have to ask for very hot.  Seems like spice is on the middle of the road.  Definitely a place to check out, and will definitely be going back for more!
Great surprise to find such an outstanding Indian restaurant in downtown Las Vegas! The food was delicious and the atmosphere was very nice :)

The food here was really amazing! Nice location just across from Container Park. We came here as part of a downtown Vegas food tour and were very pleased! Only reason we gave in 4 instead of 5 stars was because the cocktail we had wasn't our favorite (Red Sangria). As far as food, we had the Garlic Naan, Stuffed Portobello, Gobi Manchurian, Chicken Pakora, and Masala Shrimp Taco. I love Indian food and this place surely did not disappoint.
Excellent food and service. It's not cheap, but you get the quality. I'd go back, but it's a 50.00 lunch with no alcohol or tip.

Great food!! Service questionable at best. Bartender trying to do his job and the waitresses who was less than interested in attempting to do her job. We watched three parties leave after talking to her, one party of 11. Would come back but they should think about getting better help.

This place is awesome! The food is delicious and the drinks too! I went with a large group and was seated promptly. We had made a reservation though, and I was glad to see the table was set up for us. We visited a Sunday at 7:00pm and the place was already pretty busy. By 8:00pm though, it seemed to be completely full. 

I really enjoyed the food. The flavors were there and the options were plenty. I really liked the gobi manchurrian (I think I'm spelling it correctly!). And the lamb dish I had. Everything was delicious. I also ordered the watermelon salad and thought it was good but not something I would order again. 

My only suggestion is to have more service staff on the weekend. Our waitress had a lot of table to attend too and even though she was very efficient, she seemed a bit overwhelmed. It took a bit of extra time to get her attention. Other than that, this place is a must go!

Thanks again for the service and food. We loved it!

After having a disappointing service at another restaurant, we decided to come to this place in hopes for a better experience. 

We would like to say that this experience was much better and our server, Gregory, was great! He greeted us with a welcoming personality but also professional one. From the pictures, you can see that this place has a very calm and chic atmosphere. 

Gregory, our server, was great. Constantly checking in with us and communicated etas of our food. In addition, I will say that he didn't have to write down our order. He remembered everything but one item. He did end up still bringing my side dish and comped my that side dish. 

So, let's talk about the food. The food was delicious! I ordered the butter chicken, white sangria, and stuffed-cheese naan. 

My colleagues and I very much enjoyed our experience. I would recommend anyone looking for a nice dining experience and/or some good Indian food!
Authentic Indian food with super selection of both north and south Indian specialities.  Excellent service and good atmosphere.  Loved their 'Dosa'.

This is the best indian food I have eaten in Las Vegas. We went at lunch and orderedChhole bhature,  Shahi Paneer and Palak paneer kofta and it came with naan and little tice. Quantity of serving was not much in my opinion but the taste was good. I would recommend this reataurant in Las Vegas

Food was 4 stars, service 1.

If your server decides to memorize an order, then has to interrupt the table to triple check it, and then still forgets 3 items and brings out a wrong item, maybe writing it down would be a better option.  On top of that, after informing the server a dish was wrong, I was met with argument about how that was what I ordered.  Why are you arguing with me?  I am not the one who decided to try to memorize the order.  I could go on, but I will leave it at that.  Let go of your ego and use that free hand to hold a pen.
The food was excellent, with great presentation and flavor. Customer service was a little unpolished. Probably because it is new. The drinks were fair, not great.

If you're having trouble finding this restaurant amid your Fremont Street adventures, you'll know you've arrived if you see a huge Praying Mantis robot spewing flames to the beat of loud music.

We found the restaurant and sat outside along the sidewalk where sketchiness seems to reign. I was half-expecting to get stabbed or assaulted from behind, but thankfully I didn't experience that sort of rudeness.

I'm also thankful for the dishes I tried, including the Gobi Manchurian ($10) and Butter Chicken Curry Pot ($18). Feel free to check out their menu for details, but suffice it to say that both dishes were very delicious, nicely spiced at medium, and large enough to share. 

Go for the food, people watching, and that giant mechanical bug located across the street.

Excellent food and friendly good service. Dinner there with a friend last month was amazing! We had the appetizer sampler platter, divine! We loved every item and even though we were full, ordered more just to keep tasting the delicious flavors. Lamb was my favorite but everything was so good. This afternoon I carried out Indian pizza, the ultimate comfort food on this windy cold day. Perfect! It's so great to have a good INDIAN place here in the downtown neighborhood!
Best Indian food downtown. great service. Their gin and tonic on draft is amazing.

Malia Chicken Tikka is plain as can be! Never had Indian food without flavor! 

Beef curry and chicken tikka masala were both very dry and sauce is like paste! 

Dosai was great! 


Also when I mentioned to the waiter the "mild flavor" was hot he says yes everything has a spice! Then label it spicy not mild!!!!
Hands down the best Indian food in Vegas. Everything was immaculate & the service at the bar was superb! Can't wait to come back.
One of the best Indian restaurants I have been to in USA. Very authentic flavors. Came here with my parents and they loved t as well.

I got to try Turmeric for the first time today. My team at work ordered takeout for lunch and boy am I happy they did! I'd been craving Indian food for a while and this hit the spot. I got the vegetarian vindaloo lunch, spicy level 5 out of 10. I will admit that I am a bit of a weenie when it comes to spicy, but I am always trying to push my tolerance. To me the level 5 was at the brink of my spicy limit! But man was it a delicious pain! Their fried bread and naan was also top notch. 

We called ahead to order and when we got their everything was ready to go perfectly packaged! I'm always hesitant to order take out because a lot of places have a hard time getting it right, but Turmeric was on point. They also have a ton of vegetarian/vegan options if that's your thing too.
Wow, phenominal! I am not a fan of this type of food but I fell in love with them. This is my wife's type of place, we will be coming back one it finally opens.

This was a great Indian Restaurant! You have to try it if you're in Vegas and want great Indian food at good prices! Wonderful service too! Loved the Garlic Naan and light and flaky samosas. We ordered the tandoori platter for  two and it was fabulous! I highly recommend this restaurant!

I have to admit this is my first time writing a review. The only reason I am doing so was because I feel it's justified. I love Indian food and was excited this place opened near my condo downtown. So I went there yesterday with my girlfriend. We were asked to choose a table and did so. After 7-8 minutes of nobody even acknowledged us or took a drink order. It's like we weren't even there, so we decided to leave. ( they were about halfway full in back room). So I decided to give them another shot today. I sat down and gave the waitress my order. Only 3 tables were sat, it took about 6-7 minutes to bring my water out. I ordered chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. The food was good I'll have to admit, but I have ate at just about every Indian restaurant in town and it was not as good as some places. And the prices are very high, the place is just way overpriced for what you get. $18 for the masala compared to $13-15 at most places. I asked my server where my rice was and she said it's $3 for a half bowl of rice. I understand some real high end restaurants charge for rice but I have never been to an Indian place in town that charges for it. Food is good but not worth the price , and the service was sub par. I won't be back!

Enjoyed an early dinner here and was thoroughly impressed with the food.
Started with the samosas, a little different than my experience at other restaurants but not disappointing. Packed with flavor and a great opening.
Shared the tandoori platter. Lots of protein, I'd definitely recommend ordering a side of rice for that carb load. Also had the garlic naan on the side. Overall thoroughly pleased. The lamb chops left a little to be desired but everything else surpassed expectations.
Ended with dessert. Will definitely be coming again.

For the hearty drinker the Blood and Sand was amaze!

I've been here twice now, and 4 stars seems adequate. The location is great for downtown. The ambiance is definitely Indian-fusion. 

The food is great- flavorful, good qty, ideal temperature. They only lost a star bc there's always 1 dish that's been mediocre. Not sure why. It's either a weird combo (beet chaat?), or too spicy. 

It's worth checking out at least!  Great for family, friends, and anything else!

Good but not amazing. Great location on Fremont Street and across from Container Park. Full Bar. Lack of a 1+ hour wait on a Saturday night unlike other restaurants on Fremont. All reasons to like it. 
The menu is pretty decent with lots of choices but is a little pricey for the food you get. I ordered a lamb appetizer as a small meal (and it was definitely small) and I paid more than what I'd normally pay for an entree in most other Indian restaurants. My friends all ordered various entrees, a salad, rice and naan, all were reportly "okay" but not great. The naan was meh, the drinks were bleh, and the service was not stellar. 
If you're starving on Fremont Street on a Saturday night and don't want to wait 2 hours to get into another better restaurant, try this. It's totally palatable. Oh! And they have a clean bathroom.

What can I say amazing food and great service! Thank you Turmeric and staff for the most enjoyable evening! The spices were so authentic that it brought me to another place in my head! Loved it! The drinks menu looks fabulous I must try it soon! I'm a local so I will be back soon!

Great food, great service.  Lots to choose from, if you are vegetarian or not.  The waitress was very knowledgeable and gave great advice, especially to my not-spice loving husband.  Atmosphere is a.little cold but the warm naan and great appetizer s will make you feel warmed up for the wonderful flavors to come.  Parking is on the street.
One of the best restaurants in the US for Indian cuisine. I had the pleasure to meet the owner of the restaurant too. Amazing guy.

Came for Vegananuary lunch (benefiting the ASPCA). In short, everything is AMAZING! The highlight was the cauliflower appetizer - so delicious. I can't say enough about the food. Come try it! (Lots of vegetarian, vegan and gluten free options, in addition to the normal meat fare)
We've ordered Goat Biryani and Chicken tikka masala. Food was good.. chicken tikka masala was amazing.. I recommend this place.

Solid but not fabulous. Wasn't expecting much of an Indian place in Las Vegas so I was pleasantly surprised. Appetizer-samosas-tasty.  Entrees-eggplant crush, swag curry-ok. Three diners and the consensus was a 3.5/5

Don't not go here, but if you like Indian comfort food, make sure to keep your expectations low. They are overpriced (the worst, by far, of all downtown spots east of LVB - and I thought Therapy was bad in that respect!), and you don't get your money's worth; apps are $10-12 and you get a fist's worth of food -- totes fine at a nice place, but here? Are they trying to be "fancy" or "fusion?" Mint Indian Bistro already proved you can have more "upscale" Indian/Nepalese offerings and do it right. The menu here is very limited and won't be what most people are looking for in the form of familiar or comfort food. Most of the crowd favorites aren't even on the dinner menu (masala/makhani, korma, sag, rogan josh, etc.). I'm told the other location(s) are way better/different, so maybe it's just this one that has an identity crisis? It's as if the owners decided they're close enough so they should pretend they're on the strip price & run things accordingly. The beers were ridiculous -- $8 for a Blue Moon on tap, $10 for a pale, $12 for an IPA. My partner ordered an old fashioned, and it was overly sweet. He wrinkled his face and noted it had way more sugar than it was supposed to. I've heard lunch may be better, so I plan on trying that eventually.
Food was only ok. Big disappointment in the Gobi Manchurian. The eggplant appetizer was good though.

I dropped in here with a group of work colleagues on whim since the Thai place across the street had a long wait. We were all very glad we did. This is top notch Indian food.

It is not a traditional Indian restaurant, it is modern meets Indian. The decor, food and bar reflect that. The food is more appropriately portioned to share a bit and try different things. Not like your traditional huge plates of food that leave you absolutely stuffed, although if you want to, you can always ask for more "gravy and rice". You can eat nicely here and still feel like you can grab cocktails after. Speaking of cocktails, they have a decent bar with a good selection of specialty cocktails, beer and wine.

The service was very good and the chef came out to greet us after our meal. You can tell he really cares that he creates something unique and enjoyable.

Honestly, this is some of the best Indian food I have had, better than I've had in London. I'll recommending this place to anyone I know heading to Vegas.
